snippet: The military-backed government’s efforts to extinguish the memory of Rabaa al-Adawiya, the worst mass killing in Egypt’s history, are extensive.
abstract: Cairo Journal: Egypt's military-backed government is going to great lengths to extinguish the memory of Rabaa al-Adawiya, square in Cairo that became scene of mass killing after security forces fired on protesters in Aug 2013 while trying to break up Islamist sit-in of Mohamed Morsi supporters.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: The military-backed government’s efforts to extinguish the memory of Rabaa al-Adawiya, the worst mass killing in Egypt’s history, are extensive.

headline.main: Memory of a Mass Killing Becomes Another Casualty of Egyptian Protests
headline.print_headline: Memory of a Mass Killing Becomes Another Casualty of Egyptian Protests
